result.markdown:
---
title: "My Quarto Sandbox"
author: "Raul E."
date: "2023-04-09"
categories: [news, code, analysis]
image: "image.jpg"
---


Welcome to my sandbox where I can play with Quarto features.

# Callouts

:::{.callout-note}
Note that there are five types of callouts, including:
`note`, `tip`, `warning`, `caution`, and `important`.
:::

:::{.callout-tip}
## Tip With Caption

This is an example of a callout with a caption.
:::



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# install.packages("tidycensus") 
library(tidycensus)
library(tidyverse)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ──
✔ ggplot2 3.4.0      ✔ purrr   0.3.5 
✔ tibble  3.1.8      ✔ dplyr   1.0.10
✔ tidyr   1.2.1      ✔ stringr 1.4.1 
✔ readr   2.1.3      ✔ forcats 0.5.2 
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(ggplot2)
library(DBI)
library(RPostgres)
#library(sqlpetr)
library(sf)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Linking to GEOS 3.10.2, GDAL 3.4.2, PROJ 8.2.1; sf_use_s2() is TRUE
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# census_api_key(key, overwrite = FALSE, install = FALSE)
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# GDAL drivers
st_drivers() %>% 
  filter(grepl("Post", name))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
                 name          long_name write  copy is_raster is_vector   vsi
PostgreSQL PostgreSQL PostgreSQL/PostGIS  TRUE FALSE     FALSE      TRUE FALSE
```
:::
